If \\( h(z) \\) is applied to a complex number \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0, and then allowed to evolve under \\( \\frac{dz}{dt} = i\\omega z \\) without further intervention, will \\( z(t) \\) at t = T be the same as if \\( z_0 \\) was directly evolved to t = T under \\( \\frac{dz}{dt} = i\\omega z \\)?
Explanation: The transformation \\( h(z) \\) modifies the initial condition by scaling and potentially rotating \\( z_0 \\). The resulting trajectory of \\( z(t) \\) diverges from the original path due to the exponential factor \\( e^{\\alpha t} \\), which can introduce both an amplitude change and a phase rotation depending on the real and imaginary parts of \\( \\alpha \\).
